sentences: Ma ei saa seda taluda, see on nii mind ületav! (I can't stand it, it’s so overwhelming!),
Ta oli väga mind lähedane sõber. (He was a very close friend to me.),
See mõte on mulle kogu aeg mind.
context: The Estonian word 'mind' can have several meanings similar to the English 'mind', including intellect, thought, spirit, or memory. It can also be used reflexively to indicate a state of being overwhelmed or preoccupied with something.
